Developing mobile apps that can run on multiple-platforms can be achieved by cross platform app development. With the advancement in the technologies, the complexity involved in developing mobile applications has greatly reduced. For businesses, it has become a matter of concern that their applications are running on all mobile platforms or not and that too hassle-free. Thus, they are hiring many mobile app development companies to develop their business Cross-Platform Apps.

The cross-platform market is expected to touch the figure of $7.9 billion by 2019. With the help of cross-platform app development, the market is seeing a fluctuating growth due to its popularity. As cross-platform apps hold an advantage over native apps when compared to the cost, developing time and compatibility aspect, it has become the growing trend among the users.

What is Cross Platform Apps?

Cross-Platform apps are apps that can function on multiple platforms. These apps are compatible with operating on both iOS and Android. Initially, app developers preferred building apps for only a single platform because developing apps for multiple operating systems was a bit complex. But with newer techniques, creating cross-platform apps has become easier.

Everything has its own advantage and disadvantages, cross-platform also has it’s own. The major drawback is that the mobile platforms are updated frequently that means with each update you need to update your application which requires a change in code.
